column4: How do i install .bin files i download realplayergold.bin so i need help in installing it
I don't think you can.  They are likely not for linux.  In a console, say "file" followed by that filename with path, and tell me what it says
ne ways i have done this before with helix player i dont rmr the command it was some chmod bhla bhla bhla ,got ne idea
if you want it to just execute, then say "chmod +x thefilename"
this is what it says RealPlayer10GOLD.bin: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), for GNU/Linux 2.2.5, dynamically linked (uses shared libs), not stripped
okay, then chmod +x it to make it executable, and then type ./itsname to run it.  =P
by its name u mean the whole filename again
yeah
you can use tab to make it finish the name for you
its says no such file or direcotry
then you spelled it wrong, or are not looking at the right directory.  Type pwd to make it tell you where you are
Realplayr is talking bout configuring system-wide symbolic links what do i say yes or no
if you're the admin user, yes
wat is the prefix of symbolic link
however, it'll probably mess up and tell you it can't do that unless you invoke it as root.  So you um, "sudo ./thatfile"
prefix?  You mean the letter in ls -l?  it's s
/usr is the default option
oh that should be fine.  Or /usr/share
i tried running realplayer and it gives me this error "Failed to run /usr/bin/x-terminal-emulator: Child terminated with 146 status"
is there a way to uninstall this thing
